column4: I have a major problem..... does anybody know if you can rescue files from an encrypted hdd?.....
that would defeat the point of encryption, wouldn't it?
and if i have the password?
then you should be fine, assuming the volume is not corrupted.
the problem is that i accidently made a new filesystem on it (just started... was runnig for about 5 seconds then i noticed the mistake and killed the pc)
and now I cant mount it anymore....
hmm...tricky. have you tried TestDisk? might not work, but worth a shot.
i'm guessing backups aren't an option.
testdisk didnt seem to work (probably as its encrypted)
backups dont exist -.-
what did use to perform the encryption?
luks

i think you might be in serious trouble. best bet might be to peruse the dm-crypt mailing list archives (someone else has surely done the same thing already). i'm afraid i don't know what else to suggest.
hm... ok :(
well, i'd suggest keeping backups next time, but i don't want to rub it in. harsh enough lesson already, i imagine.
already thought that im in trouble -.-

the actually funny thing (well... i dont think its that funny but for others it surely is).... that i deleted a backup a few days ago because i thought ill never need it and the device wasnt encrypted -.-
i heard a clever saying recently: "The Universe tends towards maximum irony."
ill check the backup harddrive... maybe theres something to save there
might be a better bet, actually
